definition: to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head

sentences.english: Reduce edible salt bloats, smoke, barbecue food.
sentences.chinese: 减少食用盐腌，烟熏，烧烤的食物。

sentences.english: Cigarettes,camp-fires and barbecues can all start a fire in the countryside.
sentences.chinese: 香烟，营火和烧烤全部能开始一燃烧在那些农村内。

sentences.english: Las Rocas Bar and Grill is the best spot for fresh seafood specialties.
sentences.chinese: 拉斯罗卡斯酒吧和烧烤是新鲜的海鲜特产的最佳位置。

sentences.english: Recommendations with red meat, grilled and cooked cheese.
sentences.chinese: 建议搭配红肉，烧烤和熟奶酪饮用。

sentences.english: Spot ALL the barbecue skewers AND cuffs.
sentences.chinese: 找出所有的烧烤架和手铐。

sentences.english: Drain the fish cutlets , arrange them on the rack.
sentences.chinese: 取出银鳕鱼，排放烧烤架上。

sentences.english: Barbecue restaurants, red clay and trees: Georgia.
sentences.chinese: 烧烤店，红色粘土和森林，这是乔治亚州。

sentences.english: This barbecued chicken is on the house.
sentences.chinese: 这烧烤鸡是餐厅免费赠送的。

sentences.english: For safer grilled meats, keep portions small to cut down on grilling time.
sentences.chinese: 为了安全烧烤，将肉切成小块以缩短烤肉时间。

sentences.english: The O'Haras drive to Twelve Oaks for the barbeque there.
sentences.chinese: 奥哈拉一家，来到了“十二橡树”的烧烤聚会上。

sentences.english: Moreover, tourists often come and have picnics here, because of its beauty.
sentences.chinese: 要命的是，游客们慕名而来，经常烧烤野炊。

sentences.english: Barbecue smoke took flight from the Kaufmans' backyard.
sentences.chinese: 从考夫曼家的后院里，升腾起烧烤的烟气。

sentences.english: Besides ，we can take some pied magpies home for BBQ.
sentences.chinese: 此外，我们还可以打一些喜鹊回家用来烧烤。

sentences.english: Coat barbecue food with a thick sauce.
sentences.chinese: 给烧烤食品添加厚厚的调味剂。

sentences.english: Several groups of people were having barbecues in the fields.
sentences.chinese: 野外有几伙人在烧烤，其中有一人挥手招呼我。

sentences.english: Would you like to go barbecuing on the beach with me tomorrow morning?
sentences.chinese: 明天上午你愿意和我一起去海滨吃烧烤吗？

definition: see 涮鍋子|涮锅子[shuan4 guo1 zi5]
hot spicy soup (often sold in street stalls)
Sichuan poached sliced fish in hot chili oil
game/wild animals and birds hunted for food or sport
